channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: 'Why would you tinker with it if it's not broken?': Economist on why the Fed may not cut rates in September
item.description: There are risks to easing monetary policy that cast a cloud over the rate cut outlook, High Frequency Economics' Carl Weinberg told CNBC.

item.title: JPMorgan's Jamie Dimon warns inflation and interest rates may stay higher
item.description: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon on Friday issued another warning about inflation despite recent signs of easing in price pressures.

item.title: Japan data suggests possible yen intervention of around $22 billion
item.description: Markets analysts speculated that policymakers had used the opportunity of the U.S. inflation data to enter the market.

item.title: JPMorgan Chase tops second-quarter revenue expectations on strong investment banking
item.description: JPMorgan Chase on Friday posted second-quarter profit and revenue that topped analysts' expectations as investment banking fees surged 52% from a year earlier.

item.title: Elon Musk's X deceives users and breaches online content rules, EU says
item.description: Elon Musk's X is in breach of EU online content rules as the social media platform uses "dark patterns" to deceive users, the European Commission said Friday.

item.title: As the Ambani wedding gets underway — here's why Indian nuptials are so big and glamorous
item.description: The latest Ambani wedding has spotlighted the glitz and glamour of Indian nuptials on the world stage. Here's why weddings are a big affair in Indian culture.

item.title: SpaceX’s Falcon 9 rocket suffers rare inflight failure, is grounded during investigation
item.description: A SpaceX rocket carrying Starlink satellites failed midflight, in a rare misfire for the company's workhorse Falcon 9 vehicle.

item.title: Citigroup tops expectations for profit and revenue on strong Wall Street results
item.description: Citigroup on Friday posted second-quarter results that topped expectations for profit and revenue on a rebound in Wall Street activity.

item.title: Biden stumbles over Zelenskyy introduction, calls him 'President Putin'
item.description: The latest verbal gaffe by U.S. President Joe Biden comes as he faces increasing calls by Democrats to quit the 2024 election contest against Donald Trump.

item.title: Kelly Evans: The cuts are coming
Biden loses his train of thought, calls Harris 'Vice President Trump' in solo press conference
item.description: President Biden has faced growing drop-out pressure from Democratic lawmakers, donors and from some voter polling after his debate flop against Donald Trump.

item.title: Ericsson shares rise after sales fall less than expected, North America returns to growth
item.description: Ericsson reported a smaller-than-expected 7% drop in second-quarter sales as sluggish demand for 5G gear was slightly offset by growth in North America.

item.title: China gears up for next week's Third Plenum meeting. Here's why real estate isn't likely the main focus
item.description: China's real estate problems may be massive, but analysts expect the upcoming Third Plenum to focus on other areas — such as high local government debt levels.

item.title: China's imports unexpectedly drop in June, but exports beat forecasts
item.description: China's imports fell in June, missing expectations for slight growth, while exports grew more than expected, customs data released Friday showed.

item.title: Apple expands Vision Pro to more countries outside the U.S.
item.description: The Vision Pro will hit stores in Australia, Canada, France, Germany and the U.K. on Friday, following the headset's debut in Asian markets.

item.title: Ambani's wedding kicks off in India this weekend. Here's who will be at the star-studded event
item.description: Mukesh Ambani's youngest son is set to tie the knot this weekend after months-long wedding celebrations. Here's what you need to know.

item.title: Global population to peak within this century as birth rates fall, United Nations report says
item.description: The world population is on course to peak earlier than expected this century and at a lower level, the United Nations forecasts.

item.title: Samsung is developing AI features specifically for China as it looks to claw back into market
item.description: Samsung is developing its suite of artificial features known as Galaxy AI specifically for the Chinese market, the company's mobile chief TM Roh told CNBC.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: Modi in Moscow. What’s new?
item.description: The meeting is likely to have set tempers to boiling point in Washington, D.C., where the NATO military alliance was convening at the same time.

item.title: Here are the world’s top 15 airports — for on-time flights
item.description: Some 86% of flights from major airports in Cape Town, Brasilia and Panama City are on time, according to a new report by AirHelp.

item.title: Biden won't drop out of election against Trump unless polls say 'there's no way you can win'
item.description: President Joe Biden is still on track to face Donald Trump despite some Democrats wanting Vice President Kamala Harris to become their nominee.

item.title: Thursday was a historically strange day in the stock market. That may be good news
item.description: The Russell 2000 small-cap index jumped more than 3% on Thursday, but every one of the so-called "Magnificent Seven" stocks fell.

item.title: Japan's yen surges after U.S. inflation data as traders monitor possible intervention
item.description: The dollar lost around 2% against the Japanese yen on Thursday as the market was suddenly jolted by fresh inflation U.S. data.

item.title: U.S. cities are sinking. Here's what that means for homeowners
item.description: Home values in areas with high land subsidence could drop 8.1%, according to forthcoming research. It's not the only way sinking surfaces could affect consumers.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: S&P retreats, yen surges, Tesla sinks
item.description: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite retreated from record highs as investors pivoted away from Big Tech, like Nvidia and Meta Platforms.

item.title: Delta says the Olympics will cost it $100 million as travelers skip Paris
item.description: Delta says travelers are opting for other destinations or booking outside of the dates of the Olympic Games.

item.title: Japan is worried about another 'transactional' Trump presidency, Tokyo-based expert says
item.description: The Japanese government was "pretty certain that Biden had this well in hand." However, the ruling LDP is now reappraising the odds of a "Trump 2.0 presidency."

item.title: JPMorgan is bullish on this Southeast Asian country, cites opportunities in data centers
item.description: The investment bank upgraded Malaysia to "neutral" from "underweight" last week, raising its target for the Kuala Lumpur Composite Index.

item.title: Microsoft's decision to give up OpenAI board observer seat doesn't quell key concerns
item.description: Microsoft will no longer have a board observer seat at OpenAI, but regulatory and safety concerns persist.

item.title: Biden 'needs to drop out' campaign official says, more Democrats in Congress agree
item.description: President Joe Biden has refused to quit his campaign for a second term, but his debate performance against Donald Trump continues fueling Democratic panic.
